_meta.purpose: HYPOTHETICAL - Identify potential bill sponsors and champions for INTRO_EVT phase
_meta.note: This is a hypothetical/placeholder artifact. It represents what would be generated by an optional intelligence agent (intel_sponsor_targeting_intro_evt) if spawned.

assumptions: Bill vehicle has been identified (INTRO_EVT phase active)
PRE_CONCEPT has been approved via HR_PRE
scenario.purpose: Demonstrate structure and content of optional sponsor targeting analysis artifact

alignment_factors: Historical support for renewable energy policies
Previous legislative record on similar issues
primary_sponsor_candidates.engagement_strategy: Direct outreach to legislative director, emphasize committee jurisdiction alignment
risk_factors: Requires early engagement before other commitments

alignment_factors: District includes renewable energy industry presence
primary_sponsor_candidates.engagement_strategy: Engage through committee staff, highlight district benefits
risk_factors: May require additional stakeholder coalition building

champion_candidates.rationale: Strong committee position, moderate alignment, potential swing vote

primary_committee.committee_name: Senate Energy and Natural Resources Committee

key_members.engagement_approach: Direct policy discussion, highlight bipartisan support

secondary_committees.note: May have concurrent or sequential jurisdiction

signal_scan.usage: Industry signals, regulatory context, timing indicators

concept_memo.usage: Policy direction, stakeholder landscape, opposition risk

primary_sponsor_engagement.rationale: Highest alignment score, strong committee position, high sponsorship probability
primary_sponsor_engagement.engagement_timeline: Within 2-4 weeks of bill vehicle identification
primary_sponsor_engagement.engagement_approach: Direct legislative director outreach, committee briefing preparation

coalition_building.approach: Engage champion candidates early, build bipartisan support before introduction

identified_risks: Competing legislative priorities may delay introduction
Opposition may mobilize before coalition is built
mitigation_strategies: Build broad coalition before opposition mobilizes
Flexible timing to accommodate committee schedules

state_advancement.verification: This artifact does NOT advance legislative state. System remains in INTRO_EVT.

review_gate_satisfaction.verification: This artifact does NOT satisfy any review gates. No approvals are implied.

execution_authorization.verification: This artifact does NOT authorize any execution actions. All execution agents remain BLOCKED.

real_data_usage.verification: No real actors, committees, bill numbers, or member names are used. All content is fictional.

system_modification.verification: This artifact does NOT modify agent-registry.json, review queues, or legislative-state.json.

disclaimer: This artifact is HYPOTHETICAL and SPECULATIVE. It represents a placeholder structure for what an optional sponsor targeting analysis would contain. It does not represent actual member targeting or engagement. All member names, scores, and recommendations are fictional examples for demonstration purposes only. This artifact is fictional and for development reference only. It does not represent real data, authorized actions, or system state.
